00078 #include <limits.h>

00090 struct cache_t * cache_create_llc(
00091     struct core_t * const core,
00092     const char * const name,
00093     const bool read_only,
00094     const int sets,
00095     const int assoc,
00096     const int linesize,
00097     const char rp, /* replacement policy */
00098     const char ap, /* allocation policy */
00099     const char wp, /* write policy */
00100     const char wc, /* write combining */
00101     const int banks,
00102     const int bank_width, /* in bytes; i.e., the interleaving granularity */
00103     const int latency, /* in cycles */
00104     const int WBB_size, /* writeback-buffer size, in cache lines (for evictions) */
00105     const int MSHR_size, /* MSHR size (per bank), in requests */
00106     const int MSHR_banks, /* number of MSHR banks */
00107     const int begin_index,/* In case a shared cache what chunk lies with this cache*/
00108     const int end_index,
00109     struct cache_t * const next_level_cache, /* e.g., for the DL1, this should point to the L2 */
00110     struct bus_t * const next_bus /* e.g., for the DL1, this should point to the bus between DL1 and L2 */
00111     )
00112 {
00113   int i;
00114   struct cache_t * cp = (struct cache_t*) calloc(1,sizeof(*cp));
00115   if(!cp)
00116     fatal("failed to calloc cache %s",name);
00117 
00118   enum repl_policy_t replacement_policy;
00119   enum alloc_policy_t allocate_policy;
00120   enum write_policy_t write_policy;
00121   int write_combining;
00122 
00123   cp->core = core;
00124 
00125   switch(mytoupper(rp)) {
00126     case 'L': replacement_policy = REPLACE_LRU; break;
00127     case 'M': replacement_policy = REPLACE_MRU; break;
00128     case 'R': replacement_policy = REPLACE_RANDOM; break;
00129     case 'N': replacement_policy = REPLACE_NMRU; break;
00130     case 'P': replacement_policy = REPLACE_PLRU; break;
00131     case 'C': replacement_policy = REPLACE_CLOCK; break;
00132     default: fatal("unrecognized cache replacement policy");
00133   }
00134   switch(mytoupper(ap)) {
00135     case 'W': allocate_policy = WRITE_ALLOC; break;
00136     case 'N': allocate_policy = NO_WRITE_ALLOC; break;
00137     default: fatal("unrecognized cache allocation policy (W=write-alloc,N=no-write-alloc)");
00138   }
00139   switch(mytoupper(wp)) {
00140     case 'T': write_policy = WRITE_THROUGH; break;
00141     case 'B': write_policy = WRITE_BACK; break;
00142     default: fatal("unrecognized cache write policy (T=write-Through,B=write-Back)");
00143   }
00144   switch(mytoupper(wc)) {
00145     case 'C': write_combining = true; break;
00146     case 'N': write_combining = false; break;
00147     default: fatal("unrecognized cache write combining option (C=write-Combining,N=No-write-combining)");
00148   }
00149 
00150   cp->name = strdup(name);
00151   if(!cp->name)
00152     fatal("failed to strdup %s's name",name);
00153   cp->read_only = (enum read_only_t) read_only;
00154   cp->sets = sets;
00155   cp->assoc = assoc;
00156   cp->log2_assoc = (int)(ceil(log(assoc)/log(2.0)));
00157   cp->linesize = linesize;
00158   cp->replacement_policy = replacement_policy;
00159   cp->allocate_policy = allocate_policy;
00160   cp->write_policy = write_policy;
00161   cp->banks = banks;
00162   cp->bank_width = bank_width;
00163   cp->bank_mask = banks-1;
00164   cp->latency = latency;
00165   cp->write_combining = write_combining;
00166   cp->WBB_size = WBB_size;
00167   cp->MSHR_size = MSHR_size;
00168   cp->MSHR_banks = MSHR_banks;
00169   cp->MSHR_mask = MSHR_banks-1;
00170   cp->next_level = next_level_cache;
00171   cp->next_bus = next_bus;
00172   cp->check_for_work = true;
00173   cp->check_for_MSHR_fill_work = true;
00174 
00175   if((cp->replacement_policy == REPLACE_PLRU) && (assoc & (assoc-1)))
00176     fatal("Tree-based PLRU only works when associativity is a power of two");
00177   if((cp->replacement_policy == REPLACE_CLOCK) && (assoc > 64))
00178     fatal("Clock-based PLRU only works when associativity is <= 64");
00179 
00180   /* bits to shift to get to the tag */
00181   cp->addr_shift = (int)ceil(log(linesize)/log(2.0));
00182   /* bits to shift to get the bank number */
00183   cp->bank_shift = (int)ceil(log(linesize)/log(2.0));
00184 
00185   if((sets & (sets-1)) != 0)
00186     fatal("%s cache sets must be power of two");
00187   if((linesize & (linesize-1)) != 0)
00188     fatal("%s linesize must be power of two");
00189   if((banks & (banks-1)) != 0)
00190     fatal("%s banks must be power of two");
00191 
00192   cp->blocks = (struct cache_line_t**) calloc(sets,sizeof(*cp->blocks));
00193   if(!cp->blocks)
00194     fatal("failed to calloc cp->blocks");
00195   for(i=0;i<sets;i++)
00196   {
00197     /* allocate as one big block! */
00198     struct cache_line_t * line = (struct cache_line_t*) calloc(assoc,sizeof(*line));
00199     memset(line,0,assoc*sizeof(*line)); // for some weird reason valgrind was reporting that "line" was being used uninitialized, despite being calloc'd above?
00200     if(!line)
00201       fatal("failed to calloc cache line for %s",name);
00202 
00203     for(int j=0;j<assoc;j++)
00204     {
00205       line[j].way = j;
00206       line[j].next = &line[j+1];
00207     }
00208     line[assoc-1].next = NULL;
00209     cp->blocks[i] = line;
00210   }
00211 
00212   cp->heap_size = 1 << ((int) rint(ceil(log(latency+1)/log(2.0))));
00213 
00214   cp->pipe = (struct cache_action_t**) calloc(banks,sizeof(*cp->pipe));
00215   cp->pipe_num = (int*) calloc(banks,sizeof(*cp->pipe_num));
00216   cp->fill_pipe = (struct cache_fill_t**) calloc(banks,sizeof(*cp->fill_pipe));
00217   cp->fill_num = (int*) calloc(banks,sizeof(*cp->fill_num));
00218   if(!cp->pipe || !cp->fill_pipe || !cp->pipe_num || !cp->fill_num)
00219     fatal("failed to calloc cp->pipe for %s",name);
00220   for(i=0;i<banks;i++)
00221   {
00222     cp->pipe[i] = (struct cache_action_t*) calloc(cp->heap_size,sizeof(**cp->pipe));
00223     if(!cp->pipe[i])
00224       fatal("failed to calloc cp->pipe[%d] for %s",i,name);
00225     cp->fill_pipe[i] = (struct cache_fill_t*) calloc(cp->heap_size,sizeof(**cp->fill_pipe));
00226     if(!cp->fill_pipe[i])
00227       fatal("failed to calloc cp->fill_pipe[%d] for %s",i,name);
00228   }
00229 
00230   cp->MSHR = (struct cache_action_t**) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->MSHR));
00231   if(!cp->MSHR)
00232     fatal("failed to calloc cp->MSHR for %s",name);
00233   for(i=0;i<MSHR_banks;i++)
00234   {
00235     cp->MSHR[i] = (struct cache_action_t*) calloc(MSHR_size,sizeof(**cp->MSHR));
00236     if(!cp->MSHR[i])
00237       fatal("failed to calloc cp->MSHR[%d] for %s",i,name);
00238   }
00239 
00240   cp->MSHR_num = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->MSHR_num));
00241   if(!cp->MSHR_num)
00242     fatal("failed to calloc cp->MSHR_num");
00243   cp->MSHR_num_pf = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->MSHR_num_pf));
00244   if(!cp->MSHR_num_pf)
00245     fatal("failed to calloc cp->MSHR_num_pf");
00246   cp->MSHR_fill_num = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->MSHR_fill_num));
00247   if(!cp->MSHR_fill_num)
00248     fatal("failed to calloc cp->MSHR_fill_num");
00249   cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num));
00250   if(!cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num)
00251     fatal("failed to calloc cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num");
00252 
00253   cp->WBB_num = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->WBB_num));
00254   if(!cp->WBB_num)
00255     fatal("failed to calloc cp->WBB_num");
00256   cp->WBB_head = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->WBB_head));
00257   if(!cp->WBB_head)
00258     fatal("failed to calloc cp->WBB_head");
00259   cp->WBB_tail = (int*) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->WBB_tail));
00260   if(!cp->WBB_tail)
00261     fatal("failed to calloc cp->WBB_tail");
00262 
00263   cp->WBB = (struct cache_line_t**) calloc(MSHR_banks,sizeof(*cp->WBB));
00264   if(!cp->WBB)
00265     fatal("failed to calloc cp->WBB");
00266   for(i=0;i<MSHR_banks;i++)
00267   {
00268     cp->WBB[i] = (struct cache_line_t*) calloc(WBB_size,sizeof(**cp->WBB));
00269     if(!cp->WBB[i])
00270       fatal("failed to calloc cp->WBB[%d] for %s",i,name);
00271   }
00272 
00273   if(!strcasecmp(name,"LLC"))
00274   {
00275     cp->stat.core_lookups = (counter_t*) calloc(num_threads,sizeof(*cp->stat.core_lookups));
00276     cp->stat.core_misses = (counter_t*) calloc(num_threads,sizeof(*cp->stat.core_misses));
00277     if(!cp->stat.core_lookups || !cp->stat.core_misses)
00278       fatal("failed to calloc cp->stat.core_{lookups|misses} for %s",name);
00279   }
00280 
00281   return cp;
00282 }
00283 
00284 void LLC_reg_stats(
00285     struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb,
00286     struct cache_t * const cp)
00287 {
00288   char buf[256];
00289   char buf2[256];
00290   char buf3[256];
00291 
00292   assert(cp->read_only == CACHE_READWRITE);
00293 
00294   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.load_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00295   sprintf(buf2,"number of load lookups in LLC");
00296   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.load_lookups, 0, NULL);
00297   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.load_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00298   sprintf(buf2,"number of load misses in LLC");
00299   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.load_misses, 0, NULL);
00300   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.load_miss_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00301   sprintf(buf2,"load miss rate in LLC");
00302   sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.load_misses/u%d.LLC.load_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00303   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00304 
00305   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.store_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00306   sprintf(buf2,"number of store lookups in LLC");
00307   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.store_lookups, 0, NULL);
00308   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.store_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00309   sprintf(buf2,"number of store misses in LLC");
00310   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.store_misses, 0, NULL);
00311   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.store_miss_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00312   sprintf(buf2,"store miss rate in LLC");
00313   sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.store_misses/u%d.LLC.store_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00314   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00315 
00316   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.writeback_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00317   sprintf(buf2,"number of writeback lookups in LLC");
00318   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.writeback_lookups, 0, NULL);
00319   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.writeback_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00320   sprintf(buf2,"number of writeback misses in LLC");
00321   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.writeback_misses, 0, NULL);
00322   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.writeback_miss_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00323   sprintf(buf2,"writeback miss rate in LLC");
00324   sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.writeback_misses/u%d.LLC.writeback_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00325   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00326 
00327   if(cp->num_prefetchers > 0)
00328   {
00329     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.pf_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00330     sprintf(buf2,"number of prefetch lookups in LLC");
00331     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.prefetch_lookups, 0, NULL);
00332     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.pf_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00333     sprintf(buf2,"number of prefetch misses in LLC");
00334     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.prefetch_misses, 0, NULL);
00335     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.pf_miss_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00336     sprintf(buf2,"prefetch miss rate in LLC");
00337     sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.pf_misses/u%d.LLC.pf_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00338     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00339 
00340     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.pf_insertions",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00341     sprintf(buf2,"number of prefetched blocks inserted into LLC");
00342     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.prefetch_insertions, 0, NULL);
00343     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.pf_useful_insertions",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00344     sprintf(buf2,"number of prefetched blocks actually used in LLC");
00345     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.prefetch_useful_insertions, 0, NULL);
00346     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.pf_useful_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00347     sprintf(buf2,"rate of useful prefetches in LLC");
00348     sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.pf_useful_insertions/u%d.LLC.pf_insertions",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00349     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00350     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.total_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00351     sprintf(buf2,"total number of lookups in LLC (excluding writebacks)");
00352     sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.load_lookups + u%d.LLC.store_lookups + u%d.LLC.pf_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00353     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.0f");
00354     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.total_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00355     sprintf(buf2,"total number of misses in LLC (excluding writebacks)");
00356     sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.load_misses + u%d.LLC.store_misses + u%d.LLC.pf_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00357     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.0f");
00358   }
00359   else
00360   {
00361     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.total_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00362     sprintf(buf2,"total number of lookups in LLC (excluding writebacks)");
00363     sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.load_lookups + u%d.LLC.store_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00364     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.0f");
00365     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.total_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00366     sprintf(buf2,"total number of misses in LLC (excluding writebacks)");
00367     sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.load_misses + u%d.LLC.store_misses",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00368     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.0f");
00369   }
00370 
00371   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.total_miss_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00372   sprintf(buf2,"total miss rate in LLC (excluding writebacks)");
00373   sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.total_misses / u%d.LLC.total_lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00374   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00375 
00376   if(num_threads > 1)
00377   {
00378     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MPKC",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00379     sprintf(buf2,"MPKC for the LLC (no prefetches or writebacks)");
00380     sprintf(buf3,"((u%d.LLC.load_misses+u%d.LLC.store_misses) / sim_cycle) * 1000.0",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00381     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00382     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.total_MPKC",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00383     sprintf(buf2,"MPKC for the LLC (including prefetches)");
00384     sprintf(buf3,"((u%d.LLC.load_misses+u%d.LLC.store_misses+u%d.LLC.pf_misses) / sim_cycle) * 1000.0",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->node_ip);
00385     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00386   }
00387 
00388   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_write_insertions",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00389   sprintf(buf2,"total number of write/writeback insertions in LLC");
00390   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_insertions, 0, NULL);
00391   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_victim_insertions",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00392   sprintf(buf2,"total number of non-dirty WBB insertions in LLC");
00393   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_victim_insertions, 0, NULL);
00394   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_hits",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00395   sprintf(buf2,"total number hits in %s's WBB",cp->name);
00396   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_hits, 0, NULL);
00397   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_write_hits",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00398   sprintf(buf2,"total write/writeback hits in %s's WBB (write-combining)",cp->name);
00399   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_combines, 0, NULL);
00400   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_victim_hits",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00401   sprintf(buf2,"total number victim hits in %s's WBB",cp->name);
00402   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_victim_hits, 0, NULL);
00403   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_total_occupancy",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00404   sprintf(buf2,"cumulative WBB occupancy in %s (dirty-lines only)",cp->name);
00405   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_occupancy, 0, NULL);
00406   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_avg_occupancy",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00407   sprintf(buf2,"average WBB entries in use in %s (dirty-lines only)",cp->name);
00408   sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.WBB_total_occupancy / sim_cycle)",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00409   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00410   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_full_cycles",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00411   sprintf(buf2,"cycles WBB was full in %s (dirty-lines only)",cp->name);
00412   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.WBB_full_cycles, 0, NULL);
00413   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.WBB_frac_full",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00414   sprintf(buf2,"fraction of time WBBs are full in %s (dirty-lines only)",cp->name);
00415   sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.WBB_full_cycles / sim_cycle)",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00416   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00417 
00418   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MSHR_total_occupancy",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00419   sprintf(buf2,"cumulative MSHR occupancy in LLC");
00420   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.MSHR_occupancy, 0, NULL);
00421   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MSHR_avg_occupancy",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00422   sprintf(buf2,"average MSHR entries in use in LLC");
00423   sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.MSHR_total_occupancy / sim_cycle)",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00424   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00425   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MSHR_full_cycles",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00426   sprintf(buf2,"cycles MSHR was full in LLC");
00427   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.MSHR_full_cycles, 0, NULL);
00428   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MSHR_full",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00429   sprintf(buf2,"fraction of time MSHRs are full in LLC");
00430   sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.MSHR_full_cycles / sim_cycle)",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00431   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00432   sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MSHR_combos",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00433   sprintf(buf2,"MSHR requests combined in LLC");
00434   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.MSHR_combos, 0, NULL);
00435 
00436   if(num_threads == 1)
00437   {
00438     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00439     sprintf(buf2,"number of lookups in the LLC");
00440     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.core_lookups[0], 0, NULL);
00441     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.misses",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00442     sprintf(buf2,"number of misses in the LLC");
00443     stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.core_misses[0], 0, NULL);
00444     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MPKI",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00445     sprintf(buf2,"MPKI for the LLC");
00446     sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.misses / c0.commit_insn) * 1000.0",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00447     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00448     sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.MPKC",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00449     sprintf(buf2,"MPKC for the LLC");
00450     sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.misses / c0.sim_cycle) * 1000.0",cp->uncore->node_ip);
00451     stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00452   }
00453   else
00454   {
00455     /*TODO In case of private caches we register stats only for the cores in that tile, In Shared caches this has to be for all cores*/
00456     for(int i=0;i<cp->uncore->num_cores;i++)
00457     {
00458       sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.c%d.lookups",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00459       sprintf(buf2,"number of lookups by core %d in shared %s cache",cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->name);
00460       stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.core_lookups[cp->uncore->core[i]->id], 0, NULL);
00461       sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.c%d.misses",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00462       sprintf(buf2,"number of misses by core %d in shared %s cache",cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->name);
00463       stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &cp->stat.core_misses[cp->uncore->core[i]->id], 0, NULL);
00464       sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.c%d.miss_rate",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00465       sprintf(buf2,"miss rate by core %d in shared %s cache",cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->name);
00466       sprintf(buf3,"u%d.LLC.c%d.misses / u%d.LLC.c%d.lookups", cp->uncore->node_ip, cp->uncore->core[i]->id,   cp->uncore->node_ip ,   cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00467       stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00468       sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.c%d.MPKI",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00469       sprintf(buf2,"MPKI by core %d in shared %s cache",cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->name);
00470       sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.c%d.misses / c%d.commit_insn) * 1000.0",   cp->uncore->node_ip  ,cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00471       stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00472       sprintf(buf,"u%d.LLC.c%d.MPKC",cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00473       sprintf(buf2,"MPKC by core %d in shared %s cache",cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->name);
00474       sprintf(buf3,"(u%d.LLC.c%d.misses / c%d.sim_cycle) * 1000.0",   cp->uncore->node_ip,cp->uncore->core[i]->id,cp->uncore->core[i]->id);
00475       stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, buf2, buf3, "%12.4f");
00476     }
00477   }
00478 
00479   if(cp->prefetcher)
00480     for(int i=0;i<cp->num_prefetchers;i++)
00481       cp->prefetcher[i]->reg_stats(sdb,NULL);
00482 }
00483 
00484 
00485 /* Returns true if the prefetch should get inserted into the cache */
00486 static int prefetch_filter_lookup(
00487     struct prefetch_filter_t * const p,
00488     const md_paddr_t addr)
00489 {
00490   if(sim_cycle >= (p->last_reset + p->reset_interval))
00491   {
00492     for(int i=0;i<p->num_entries;i++)
00493       p->table[i] = 3;
00494     p->last_reset = sim_cycle - (sim_cycle % p->reset_interval);
00495     return true;
00496   }
00497 
00498   int index = addr & p->mask;
00499   return (p->table[index] >= 2);
00500 }
00501 
00502 /* Update the filter's predictor based on whether a prefetch was useful or not. */
00503 static void prefetch_filter_update(
00504     struct prefetch_filter_t * const p,
00505     const md_paddr_t addr,
00506     const int useful)
00507 {
00508   const int index = addr & p->mask;
00509   if(sim_cycle > (p->last_reset + p->reset_interval))
00510   {
00511     for(int i=0;i<p->num_entries;i++)
00512       p->table[i] = 3;
00513     p->last_reset = sim_cycle - (sim_cycle % p->reset_interval);
00514   }
00515   if(useful)
00516   {
00517     if(p->table[index] < 3)
00518       p->table[index]++;
00519   }
00520   else
00521   {
00522     if(p->table[index] > 0)
00523       p->table[index]--;
00524   }
00525 }
00526 
00527 
00528 
00529 
00530 /* Check to see if a given address can be found in the cache.  This is only a "peek" function
00531    in that it does not update any hit/miss stats, although it does update replacement state. */
00532 struct cache_line_t * cache_is_hit_llc(
00533     struct cache_t * const cp,
00534     const enum cache_command cmd,
00535     const md_paddr_t addr,
00536     struct core_t * const core)
00537 {
00538   const md_paddr_t block_addr = addr >> cp->addr_shift;
00539   const int index = block_addr & (cp->sets-1);
00540   struct cache_line_t * p = cp->blocks[index];
00541   struct cache_line_t * prev = NULL;
00542 
00543   while(p) /* search all of the ways */
00544   {
00545     if(p->valid && (p->tag == block_addr)) /* hit */
00546     {
00547       if(cmd != CACHE_WRITEBACK)
00548         switch(cp->replacement_policy)
00549         {
00550           case REPLACE_PLRU: /* tree-based pseudo-LRU */
00551           {
00552             int bitmask = cp->blocks[index][0].meta;
00553             const int way = p->way;
00554             for(int i=0;i<cp->log2_assoc;i++)
00555             {
00556               const int pos = (way >> (cp->log2_assoc-i)) + (1<<i);
00557               
00558               if((way>>(cp->log2_assoc-i-1)) & 1)
00559                 bitmask |= (1<<pos);
00560               else
00561                 bitmask &= ~(1<<pos);
00562             }
00563             cp->blocks[index][0].meta = bitmask;
00564           }
00565             /* NO BREAK IN THE CASE STATEMENT HERE: Do the LRU ordering, too.
00566                This doesn't affect the behavior of the replacement policy, but
00567                for highly-associative caches it'll speed up any subsequent
00568                searches (assuming temporal locality) */
00569 
00570           case REPLACE_RANDOM: /* similar: random doesn't need it, but this can speed up searches */
00571           case REPLACE_LRU:
00572           case REPLACE_NMRU:
00573             {
00574               if(prev) /* insert back at front of list */
00575               {
00576                 prev->next = p->next;
00577                 p->next = cp->blocks[index];
00578                 cp->blocks[index] = p;
00579               }
00580               break;
00581             }
00582           case REPLACE_MRU:
00583             {
00584               if(p->next) /* only move node if not already at end of list */
00585               {
00586                 /* remove node */
00587                 if(prev)
00588                   prev->next = p->next;
00589                 else
00590                   cp->blocks[index] = p->next;
00591 
00592                 /* go to end of list */
00593                 prev = p->next;
00594                 while(prev->next)
00595                   prev = prev->next;
00596                 
00597                 /* stick ourselves there */
00598                 prev->next = p;
00599                 p->next = NULL;
00600               }
00601               break;
00602             }
00603           case REPLACE_CLOCK:
00604           {
00605             cp->blocks[index][0].meta |= 1ULL<<p->way; /* set referenced bit */
00606             break;
00607           }
00608           default:
00609             fatal("policy not yet implemented");
00610         }
00611 
00612       if(cmd == CACHE_WRITE || cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK)
00613       {
00614         cache_assert(cp->read_only != CACHE_READONLY,NULL);
00615         if(cp->write_policy == WRITE_BACK) /* write-thru doesn't have dirty lines */
00616           p->dirty = true;
00617       }
00618 
00619       return p;
00620     }
00621     prev = p;
00622     p = p->next;
00623   }
00624 
00625   /* miss */
00626   return NULL;
00627 }
00628 
00629 /* Check to see if a given address can be found in the cache.  This is a *true* "peek"
00630    function; the replacement state is not touched. */
00631 static struct cache_line_t * cache_peek_llc(
00632     const struct cache_t * const cp,
00633     const md_paddr_t addr)
00634 {
00635   const md_paddr_t block_addr = addr >> cp->addr_shift;
00636   const int index = block_addr & (cp->sets-1);
00637   struct cache_line_t * p = cp->blocks[index];
00638 
00639   while(p) /* search all of the ways */
00640   {
00641     if(p->valid && (p->tag == block_addr)) /* hit */
00642     {
00643       return p;
00644     }
00645     p = p->next;
00646   }
00647 
00648   /* miss */
00649   return NULL;
00650 }
00651 
00652 /* Overwrite the victim line with a new block.  This function only gets called after
00653    the previous evictee (as determined by the replacement policy) has already been
00654    removed, which means there is at least one invalid line (which we use for the
00655    newly inserted line). */
00656 void cache_insert_block_llc(
00657     struct cache_t * const cp,
00658     const enum cache_command cmd,
00659     const md_paddr_t addr,
00660     core_t * const core)
00661 {
00663   /* assumes block not already present */
00664   const md_paddr_t block_addr = addr >> cp->addr_shift;
00665   const int index = block_addr & (cp->sets-1);
00666   struct cache_line_t * p = cp->blocks[index];
00667   struct cache_line_t *prev = NULL;
00668 
00669   /* there had better be an invalid line now - cache_get_evictee should
00670      have already returned a line to be invalidated */
00671   while(p)
00672   {
00673     if(!p->valid)
00674       break;
00675     prev = p;
00676     p = p->next;
00677   }
00678 
00679   cache_assert(p,(void)0);
00680   p->tag = block_addr;
00681   p->core = core;
00682   p->valid = true;
00683   if(cmd == CACHE_WRITE || cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK)
00684     p->dirty = true;
00685   else
00686     p->dirty = false;
00687   if(cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH)
00688   {
00689     p->prefetched = true;
00690     CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.prefetch_insertions++;)
00691   }
00692 
00693   if(cmd != CACHE_WRITEBACK) /* writebacks don't update replacement state */
00694   {
00695     switch(cp->replacement_policy)
00696     {
00697       case REPLACE_PLRU: /* tree-based pseudo-LRU */
00698       {
00699         int bitmask = cp->blocks[index][0].meta;
00700         const int way = p->way;
00701         for(int i=0;i<cp->log2_assoc;i++)
00702         {
00703           int pos = (way >> (cp->log2_assoc-i)) + (1<<i);
00704           
00705           if((way>>(cp->log2_assoc-i-1)) & 1)
00706             bitmask |= (1<<pos);
00707           else
00708             bitmask &= ~(1<<pos);
00709         }
00710         cp->blocks[index][0].meta = bitmask;
00711       }
00712       /* same comment about case statement fall-through as in cache_is_hit() */
00713       case REPLACE_RANDOM:
00714       case REPLACE_LRU:
00715       case REPLACE_NMRU:
00716         if(prev) /* put to front of list */
00717         {
00718           prev->next = p->next;
00719           p->next = cp->blocks[index];
00720           cp->blocks[index] = p;
00721         }
00722         break;
00723       case REPLACE_MRU:
00724         if(p->next) /* only move node if not already at end of list */
00725         {
00726           /* remove node */
00727           if(prev)
00728             prev->next = p->next;
00729           else
00730             cp->blocks[index] = p->next;
00731 
00732           /* go to end of list */
00733           prev = p->next;
00734           while(prev->next)
00735             prev = prev->next;
00736           
00737           /* stick ourselves there */
00738           prev->next = p;
00739           p->next = NULL;
00740         }
00741         break;
00742       case REPLACE_CLOCK:
00743       {
00744         /* do not set referenced bit */
00745         break;
00746       }
00747       default:
00748         fatal("policy not yet implemented");
00749     }
00750   }
00751 }
00752 
00753 /* caller of get_evictee is responsible for writing back (if needed) and
00754    invalidating the entry prior to inserting a new block */
00755 struct cache_line_t * cache_get_evictee_llc(
00756     struct cache_t * const cp,
00757     const md_paddr_t addr,
00758     core_t * const core)
00759 {
00760   int block_addr = addr >> cp->addr_shift;
00761   int index = block_addr & (cp->sets-1);
00762   struct cache_line_t * p = cp->blocks[index];
00763 
00764   switch(cp->replacement_policy)
00765   {
00766     /* this works for both LRU and MRU, since MRU just sorts its recency list backwards */
00767     case REPLACE_LRU:
00768     case REPLACE_MRU:
00769     {
00770       while(p)
00771       {
00772         if(!p->next || !p->valid) /* take any invalid line, else take the last one (LRU) */
00773           return p;
00774 
00775         p = p->next;
00776       }
00777       break;
00778     }
00779     case REPLACE_RANDOM:
00780     {
00781       /* use an invalid block if possible */
00782       while(p)
00783       {
00784         if(!p->valid) /* take any invalid line */
00785           return p;
00786 
00787         p = p->next;
00788       }
00789 
00790       if(!p) /* no invalid line, pick at random */
00791       {
00792         const int pos = random() % cp->assoc;
00793         p = cp->blocks[index];
00794 
00795         for(int i=0;i<pos;i++)
00796           p = p->next;
00797 
00798         return p;
00799       }
00800 
00801       break;
00802     }
00803     case REPLACE_NMRU:
00804     {
00805       /* use an invalid block if possible */
00806       while(p)
00807       {
00808         if(!p->valid) /* take any invalid line */
00809           return p;
00810         p = p->next;
00811       }
00812 
00813       if((cp->assoc > 1) && !p) /* no invalid line, pick at random from non-MRU */
00814       {
00815         const int pos = random() % (cp->assoc-1);
00816         p = cp->blocks[index];
00817         p = p->next; /* skip MRU */
00818 
00819         for(int i=0;i<pos;i++)
00820           p = p->next;
00821       }
00822       return p;
00823     }
00824     case REPLACE_PLRU:
00825     {
00826       int bitmask = cp->blocks[index][0].meta;
00827       int i;
00828       int node = 1;
00829 
00830       while(p)
00831       {
00832         if(!p->valid) /* take any invalid line */
00833           return p;
00834         p = p->next;
00835       }
00836 
00837       for(i=0;i<cp->log2_assoc;i++)
00838       {
00839         const int bit = (bitmask >> node) & 1;
00840 
00841         node = (node<<1) + !bit;
00842       }
00843 
00844       const int way = node & ~(1<<cp->log2_assoc);
00845 
00846       p = cp->blocks[index];
00847       for(i=0;i<cp->assoc;i++)
00848       {
00849         if(p->way==way)
00850           break;
00851         p = p->next;
00852       }
00853 
00854       return p;
00855     }
00856     case REPLACE_CLOCK:
00857     {
00858       int just_in_case = 0;
00859 
00860       while(1)
00861       {
00862         qword_t way = cp->blocks[index][1].meta;
00863         struct cache_line_t * p = &cp->blocks[index][way];
00864 
00865         /* increment clock */
00866         cp->blocks[index][1].meta = modinc(way,cp->assoc); //(way+1) % cp->assoc;
00867 
00868         if(!p->valid) /* take any invalid line */
00869         {
00870           cp->blocks[index][0].meta &= ~(1ULL<<p->way); /* make sure referenced bit is clear */
00871           return p;
00872         }
00873         else if(!((cp->blocks[index][0].meta >> p->way) & 1)) /* not referenced */
00874         {
00875           return p;
00876         }
00877         else
00878         {
00879           cp->blocks[index][0].meta &= ~(1ULL<<p->way); /* clear referenced bit */
00880         }
00881 
00882         just_in_case++;
00883         if(just_in_case > (2*cp->assoc))
00884           fatal("Clock-PLRU has gone around twice without finding an evictee for %s",cp->name);
00885       }
00886     }
00887     default:
00888       fatal("policy not yet implemented");
00889   }
00890 
00891   fatal("unreachable code");
00892 }
00893 
00894 
00895 /* input state: assumes that the new node has just been inserted at
00896    insert_position and all remaining nodes obey the heap property */
00897 static void cache_heap_balance(
00898     struct cache_action_t * const pipe,
00899     const int insert_position)
00900 {
00901   int pos = insert_position;
00902   //struct cache_action_t tmp;
00903   while(pos > 1)
00904   {
00905     int parent = pos >> 1;
00906     if(pipe[parent].pipe_exit_time > pipe[pos].pipe_exit_time)
00907     {
00908       /*
00909       tmp = pipe[parent];
00910       pipe[parent] = pipe[pos];
00911       pipe[pos] = tmp;
00912       */
00913       memswap(&pipe[parent],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
00914       pos = parent;
00915     }
00916     else
00917       return;
00918   }
00919 }
00920 
00921 /* input state: pipe_num is the number of elements in the heap
00922    prior to removing the root node. */
00923 static void cache_heap_remove(
00924     struct cache_action_t * const pipe,
00925     const int pipe_num)
00926 {
00927   if(pipe_num == 1) /* only one node to remove */
00928   {
00929     pipe[1].cb = NULL;
00930     pipe[1].pipe_exit_time = TICK_T_MAX;
00931     return;
00932   }
00933 
00934   pipe[1] = pipe[pipe_num]; /* move last node to root */
00935   //struct cache_action_t tmp;
00936 
00937   /* delete previous last node */
00938   pipe[pipe_num].cb = NULL;
00939   pipe[pipe_num].pipe_exit_time = TICK_T_MAX;
00940 
00941   /* push node down until heap property re-established */
00942   int pos = 1;
00943   while(1)
00944   {
00945     int Lindex = pos<<1;     // index of left child
00946     int Rindex = (pos<<1)+1; // index of right child
00947     tick_t myValue = pipe[pos].pipe_exit_time;
00948 
00949     tick_t Lvalue = TICK_T_MAX;
00950     tick_t Rvalue = TICK_T_MAX;
00951     if(Lindex < pipe_num) /* valid index */
00952       Lvalue = pipe[Lindex].pipe_exit_time;
00953     if(Rindex < pipe_num) /* valid index */
00954       Rvalue = pipe[Rindex].pipe_exit_time;
00955 
00956     if(((myValue > Lvalue) && (Lvalue != TICK_T_MAX)) ||
00957        ((myValue > Rvalue) && (Rvalue != TICK_T_MAX)))
00958     {
00959       if(Rvalue == TICK_T_MAX) /* swap pos with L */
00960       {
00961         /* tmp = pipe[Lindex];
00962         pipe[Lindex] = pipe[pos];
00963         pipe[pos] = tmp; */
00964         memswap(&pipe[Lindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
00965         return;
00966       }
00967       else if((myValue > Lvalue) && (Lvalue < Rvalue))
00968       {
00969         /* tmp = pipe[Lindex];
00970         pipe[Lindex] = pipe[pos];
00971         pipe[pos] = tmp; */
00972         memswap(&pipe[Lindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
00973         pos = Lindex;
00974       }
00975       else /* swap pos with R */
00976       {
00977         /* tmp = pipe[Rindex];
00978         pipe[Rindex] = pipe[pos];
00979         pipe[pos] = tmp; */
00980         memswap(&pipe[Rindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
00981         pos = Rindex;
00982       }
00983     }
00984     else
00985       return;
00986   }
00987 }
00988 
00989 
00990 /* Can a cache access get enqueued into the cache?  Returns true if it
00991    can.  Cases when it can't include, for example, more than one request
00992    per cycle goes to the same bank, or if a bank has been locked up. */
00993 int cache_enqueuable_llc(
00994     const struct cache_t * const cp,
00995     const int thread_id,
00996     const md_paddr_t addr)
00997 {
00998   md_paddr_t paddr;
00999   if(thread_id == DO_NOT_TRANSLATE)
01000     paddr = addr;
01001   else
01002     paddr = addr;       //v2p_translate(thread_id,addr);
01003   const int bank = GET_BANK(paddr);
01004   if(cp->pipe_num[bank] < cp->latency)
01005     return true;
01006   else
01007     return false;
01008 }
01009 
01010 /* Enqueue a cache access request to the cache.  Assumes you already
01011    called cache_enqueuable. */
01012 void cache_enqueue_llc(
01013     struct core_t * const core,
01014     struct cache_t * const cp,
01015     struct cache_t * const prev_cp,
01016     const enum cache_command cmd,
01017     const int thread_id,
01018     const md_addr_t PC,
01019     const md_paddr_t addr,
01020     const seq_t action_id,
01021     const int MSHR_bank,
01022     const int MSHR_index,
01023     void * const op,
01024     void (*const cb)(void *),
01025     void (*const miss_cb)(void *, int),
01026     bool (*const translated_cb)(void *,seq_t),
01027     seq_t (*const get_action_id)(void *) )
01028 {
01029   md_paddr_t paddr;
01030 
01031   //if(strcmp(cp->name,"IL1")==0)
01032         //fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld]IL1 enqueue_llc %llx cmd %d ",sim_cycle, addr, cmd );
01033 
01034   //if(strcmp(cp->name,"DL1")==0)
01035         //fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld]DL1 enqueue_llc %llx cmd %d ",sim_cycle, addr, cmd );
01036 
01037   //if(strcmp(cp->name,"LLC")==0)
01038         //fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld][UnCore%d]LLC enqueue_llc %llx cmd %d ",sim_cycle,cp->uncore->node_ip, addr, cmd );
01039 
01040 
01041 
01042   if(thread_id == DO_NOT_TRANSLATE)
01043     paddr = addr;
01044   else
01045     paddr = addr;       //v2p_translate(thread_id,addr); /* for the IL1/DL1, we need a virtual-to-physical translation */
01046   const int bank = GET_BANK(paddr);
01047 
01048   /* heap initial insertion position */
01049   const int insert_position = cp->pipe_num[bank]+1;
01050   cache_assert(cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].cb == NULL,(void)0);
01051   cache_assert(cb != NULL,(void)0);
01052 
01053   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].core = core;
01054   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].prev_cp = prev_cp;
01055   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].cmd = cmd;
01056   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].PC = PC;
01057   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].paddr = paddr;
01058   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].op = op;
01059   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].action_id = action_id;
01060   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].MSHR_bank = MSHR_bank;
01061   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].MSHR_index = MSHR_index;
01062   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].cb = cb;
01063   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].miss_cb = miss_cb;
01064   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].translated_cb = translated_cb;
01065   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].get_action_id = get_action_id;
01066   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].when_started = sim_cycle;
01067   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].when_returned = TICK_T_MAX;
01068 
01069 
01070   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].pipe_exit_time = sim_cycle+cp->latency;
01071 
01072   cp->pipe[bank][insert_position].miss_cb_invoked = false;
01073 
01074   assert(insert_position < cp->heap_size);
01075   cache_heap_balance(cp->pipe[bank],insert_position);
01076 
01077   cp->pipe_num[bank]++;
01078   //cache_assert(cp->pipe_num[bank] <= cp->latency,(void)0);
01079 
01080   cp->check_for_work = true;
01081   cp->check_for_pipe_work = true;
01082 
01083 }
01084 
01085 /* Returns true if there's at least one free entry in the write-back buffer */
01086 static inline int WBB_available(
01087     const struct cache_t * const cp,
01088     const md_paddr_t paddr)
01089 {
01090   const int bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(paddr);
01091   return cp->WBB_num[bank] < cp->WBB_size;
01092 }
01093 
01094 /* Insert a writeback request into the WBB; assumes you already called WBB_available
01095    to make sure there's room. */
01096 static void WBB_insert(
01097     struct cache_t * const cp,
01098     struct cache_line_t * const cache_block)
01099 {
01100   /* don't need to cache invalid blocks */
01101   if(!cache_block->valid)
01102     return;
01103 
01104   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.WBB_insertions++;)
01105   const int bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(cache_block->tag << cp->addr_shift);
01106 
01107   if(cp->write_combining)
01108   {
01109     int i;
01110     for(i=0;i<cp->WBB_num[bank];i++)
01111     {
01112       int index = mod2m(cp->WBB_head[bank]+i,cp->WBB_size); //(cp->WBB_head[bank] + i) % cp->WBB_size;
01113       if(cp->WBB[bank][index].valid && (cp->WBB[bank][index].tag == cache_block->tag))
01114       {
01115         /* if can combine with another write that's already
01116            waiting in the WBB, then don't need to add new request */
01117         CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.WBB_combines++;)
01118         return;
01119       }
01120     }
01121   }
01122 
01123   struct cache_line_t * p = &cp->WBB[bank][cp->WBB_tail[bank]];
01124 
01125   p->core = cache_block->core;
01126   p->tag = cache_block->tag;
01127   p->valid = cache_block->valid;
01128   p->dirty = cache_block->dirty;
01129   p->c_state = cache_block->c_state;
01130   p->victim = false;
01131 
01132   cp->WBB_num[bank]++;
01133   cache_assert(cp->WBB_num[bank] <= cp->WBB_size,(void)0);
01134   cp->WBB_tail[bank] = modinc(cp->WBB_tail[bank],cp->WBB_size); //(cp->WBB_tail[bank] + 1) % cp->WBB_size;
01135   cp->check_for_work = true;
01136   cp->check_for_WBB_work = true;
01137 }
01138 
01139 /* insert if room, but this line doesn't need to be written back to next level */
01140 static void WBB_victim_insert(
01141     struct cache_t * const cp,
01142     struct cache_line_t * const cache_block)
01143 {
01144   /* don't need to cache invalid blocks */
01145   if(!cache_block->valid)
01146     return;
01147 
01148   const int bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(cache_block->tag << cp->addr_shift);
01149 
01150   if(cp->WBB_num[bank] >= cp->WBB_size) /* can't do anything if full */
01151     return;
01152 
01153   const int num_available = cp->WBB_size - cp->WBB_num[bank];
01154 
01155   /* random insertion among non-dirty lines */
01156   int index = mod2m(cp->WBB_head[bank]+cp->WBB_num[bank],cp->WBB_size); // tail index
01157   index += random() % num_available;
01158   index = mod2m(index,cp->WBB_size);
01159 
01160   struct cache_line_t * p = &cp->WBB[bank][index];
01161 
01162   /* Victim lines written to can end up out-of-order with respect to the
01163      regular circular queue order.  In this rare case, we just skip the
01164      victim insertion because we cannot overwrite the dirty line.  One could
01165      try to re-search for a non-dirty line, but that gets ugly. */
01166   if(p->dirty)
01167     return;
01168 
01169   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.WBB_victim_insertions++;)
01170   p->core = cache_block->core;
01171   p->tag = cache_block->tag;
01172   p->valid = cache_block->valid;
01173   cache_assert(!cache_block->dirty,(void)0);
01174   p->dirty = false;
01175   p->victim = true;
01176 }
01177 
01178 /* Returns true if at least one MSHR entry is free/available. */
01179 static inline int MSHR_available(
01180     const struct cache_t * const cp,
01181     const md_paddr_t paddr)
01182 {
01183   const int bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(paddr);
01184   return cp->MSHR_num[bank] < cp->MSHR_size;
01185 }
01186 
01187 /* Returns a pointer to a free MSHR entry; assumes you already called
01188    MSHR_available to make sure there's room */
01189 static struct cache_action_t * MSHR_allocate(
01190     struct cache_t * const cp,
01191     const md_paddr_t paddr,
01192     const enum cache_command cmd)
01193 {
01194   const int bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(paddr);
01195 
01196   struct cache_action_t * prev = NULL;
01197 
01198   /* Check to see if there are any other requests to the same
01199      cache line; if so, coalesce the requests.  Note, this
01200      implementation of request-combining still uses one MSHR
01201      entry per request, but only one is sent to the next level
01202      of the cache hierarchy. */
01203   for(int i=0;i<cp->MSHR_size;i++)
01204   {
01205     if((cp->MSHR[bank][i].cb != NULL) && 
01206         (cp->MSHR[bank][i].paddr >> cp->addr_shift) == (paddr >> cp->addr_shift) &&
01207         (cp->MSHR[bank][i].MSHR_link == NULL) &&
01208         (cp->MSHR[bank][i].when_returned == TICK_T_MAX))
01209     {
01210       cp->stat.MSHR_combos++;
01211       prev = &cp->MSHR[bank][i];
01212       break;
01213     }
01214   }
01215 
01216   for(int i=0;i<cp->MSHR_size;i++)
01217     if(cp->MSHR[bank][i].cb == NULL)
01218     {
01219       cp->MSHR_num[bank]++;
01220       cache_assert(cp->MSHR_num[bank] <= cp->MSHR_size,NULL);
01221       cp->check_for_work = true;
01222       cp->check_for_MSHR_work = true;
01223       cache_assert(cp->MSHR[bank][i].MSHR_link == NULL,NULL);
01224       cp->MSHR[bank][i].MSHR_link = NULL;
01225       if(prev)
01226       {
01227         /* if this request can be combined with others,
01228            then link it onto the end of the chain */
01229         prev->MSHR_link = &cp->MSHR[bank][i];
01230         cp->MSHR[bank][i].when_returned = prev->when_returned;
01231         cp->MSHR[bank][i].MSHR_linked = true;
01232       }
01233       else
01234       {
01235         cp->MSHR[bank][i].MSHR_linked = false;
01236       }
01237       return &cp->MSHR[bank][i];
01238     }
01239 
01240   fatal("request for MSHR failed");
01241 }
01242 
01243 static void dummy_callback(void * p)
01244 {
01245   /* this is just a place holder for cast-out writebacks
01246      in a write-back cache */
01247 }
01248 
01249 /* Called when a LLC cache miss gets serviced. */
01250 void fill_arrived_llc(
01251     struct cache_t * const cp,
01252     unsigned long long int address)
01253 {
01254   bool flag=false;
01255   for(int b=0;b<cp->MSHR_banks;b++)
01256   {
01257       int bank = (b) & cp->MSHR_mask;
01258       if(cp->MSHR_fill_num[bank])
01259       {
01260         /* find oldest returned request to process */
01261         for(int i=0;i<cp->MSHR_size;i++)
01262         {
01263                 struct cache_action_t * MSHR = &cp->MSHR[bank][i];
01264                 if( (MSHR->paddr >> cp->addr_shift) == (address >> cp->addr_shift) )
01265                 {
01266                         flag=true;
01267                         if(MSHR->cb != NULL) /* original request was squashed */
01268                                 MSHR->when_returned = sim_cycle;
01269                         MSHR->MSHR_linked=false;
01270                         MSHR->MSHR_link=NULL;
01271                 }
01272         }
01273       }
01274   }
01275   if(!flag)
01276   {
01277         fprintf(stdout,"\nunknown %llx",address);
01278   }
01279 
01280   cp->check_for_work = true;
01281   cp->check_for_MSHR_fill_work = true;
01282 
01283  
01284   /* NOTE: recursive calls to fill_arrived will be called
01285      by the MSHR_fill handling code in cache_process */
01286 }
01287 
01288 
01289 /* input state: assumes that the new node has just been inserted at
01290    insert_position and all remaining nodes obey the heap property */
01291 static void fill_heap_balance(
01292     struct cache_fill_t * const pipe,
01293     const int insert_position)
01294 {
01295   int pos = insert_position;
01296   //struct cache_fill_t tmp;
01297   while(pos > 1)
01298   {
01299     int parent = pos >> 1;
01300     if(pipe[parent].pipe_exit_time > pipe[pos].pipe_exit_time)
01301     {
01302       /* tmp = pipe[parent];
01303       pipe[parent] = pipe[pos];
01304       pipe[pos] = tmp; */
01305       memswap(&pipe[parent],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
01306       pos = parent;
01307     }
01308     else
01309       return;
01310   }
01311 }
01312 
01313 /* input state: pipe_num is the number of elements in the heap
01314    prior to removing the root node. */
01315 static void fill_heap_remove(
01316     struct cache_fill_t * const pipe,
01317     const int pipe_num)
01318 {
01319   if(pipe_num == 1) /* only one node to remove */
01320   {
01321     pipe[1].valid = false;
01322     pipe[1].pipe_exit_time = TICK_T_MAX;
01323     return;
01324   }
01325 
01326   pipe[1] = pipe[pipe_num]; /* move last node to root */
01327   //struct cache_fill_t tmp;
01328 
01329   /* delete previous last node */
01330   pipe[pipe_num].valid = false;
01331   pipe[pipe_num].pipe_exit_time = TICK_T_MAX;
01332 
01333   /* push node down until heap property re-established */
01334   int pos = 1;
01335   while(1)
01336   {
01337     int Lindex = pos<<1;     // index of left child
01338     int Rindex = (pos<<1)+1; // index of right child
01339     tick_t myValue = pipe[pos].pipe_exit_time;
01340 
01341     tick_t Lvalue = TICK_T_MAX;
01342     tick_t Rvalue = TICK_T_MAX;
01343     if(Lindex < pipe_num) /* valid index */
01344       Lvalue = pipe[Lindex].pipe_exit_time;
01345     if(Rindex < pipe_num) /* valid index */
01346       Rvalue = pipe[Rindex].pipe_exit_time;
01347 
01348     if(((myValue > Lvalue) && (Lvalue != TICK_T_MAX)) ||
01349        ((myValue > Rvalue) && (Rvalue != TICK_T_MAX)))
01350     {
01351       if(Rvalue == TICK_T_MAX) /* swap pos with L */
01352       {
01353         /* tmp = pipe[Lindex];
01354         pipe[Lindex] = pipe[pos];
01355         pipe[pos] = tmp; */
01356         memswap(&pipe[Lindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
01357         return;
01358       }
01359       else if((myValue > Lvalue) && (Lvalue < Rvalue))
01360       {
01361         /* tmp = pipe[Lindex];
01362         pipe[Lindex] = pipe[pos];
01363         pipe[pos] = tmp; */
01364         memswap(&pipe[Lindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
01365         pos = Lindex;
01366       }
01367       else /* swap pos with R */
01368       {
01369         /* tmp = pipe[Rindex];
01370         pipe[Rindex] = pipe[pos];
01371         pipe[pos] = tmp; */
01372         memswap(&pipe[Rindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
01373         pos = Rindex;
01374       }
01375     }
01376     else
01377       return;
01378   }
01379 }
01380 
01381 
01382 /* We are assuming separate ports for cache fills; returns true if the fill pipeline
01383    can accept a fill request. */
01384 static inline bool cache_fillable_llc(
01385     const struct cache_t * const cp,
01386     const md_paddr_t paddr)
01387 {
01388   const int bank = GET_BANK(paddr);
01389   if(cp->fill_num[bank] < cp->latency)
01390     return true;
01391   else
01392     return false;
01393 }
01394 
01395 /* Do the actual fill; assume you already called cache_fillable */
01396 static inline void cache_fill_llc(
01397     struct cache_t * const cp,
01398     const enum cache_command cmd,
01399     const md_paddr_t paddr,
01400     struct core_t * core)
01401 {
01402   const int bank = GET_BANK(paddr);
01403   const int insert_position = cp->fill_num[bank]+1;
01404   cache_assert(!cp->fill_pipe[bank][insert_position].valid,(void)0);
01405 
01406 
01407   //if(strcmp(cp->name,"LLC")==0)
01408         //fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld]LLC fill_llc %llx cmd %d ",sim_cycle, paddr, cmd );
01409 
01410   cp->fill_pipe[bank][insert_position].valid = true;
01411   cp->fill_pipe[bank][insert_position].cmd = cmd;
01412   cp->fill_pipe[bank][insert_position].paddr = paddr;
01413   cp->fill_pipe[bank][insert_position].core = core;
01414 
01415   cp->fill_pipe[bank][insert_position].pipe_exit_time = sim_cycle+cp->latency;
01416 
01417   assert(insert_position < cp->heap_size);
01418   fill_heap_balance(cp->fill_pipe[bank],insert_position);
01419 
01420   cp->fill_num[bank]++;
01421   cache_assert(cp->fill_num[bank] <= cp->latency,(void)0);
01422   cp->check_for_work = true;
01423   cp->check_for_fill_work = true;
01424 }
01425 
01426 /* simulate one cycle of the cache */
01427 void cache_process_llc(struct cache_t * const cp)
01428 {
01429   int b;
01430 
01431   bool work_found = false;
01432   bool MSHR_fill_work_found = false;
01433   bool fill_work_found = false;
01434   bool pipe_work_found = false;
01435   bool MSHR_work_found = false;
01436   bool WBB_work_found = false;
01437 
01438 //if(cp->uncore->id==2)
01439 /*if(sim_cycle>2295090)
01440 {
01441   fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld][Uncore%d] MSHR entries :",sim_cycle,cp->uncore->node_ip);
01442   for(int b=0;b<cp->MSHR_banks;b++)
01443   {
01444         fprintf(stdout,"%d ", cp->MSHR_fill_num[b]);
01445                 for(int i=0;i<cp->MSHR_size;i++)
01446                         if(cp->MSHR[b][i].when_returned==TICK_T_MAX)
01447                                 fprintf(stdout,"\n 0x%llx %lld ",cp->MSHR[b][i].paddr, cp->MSHR[b][i].when_started);
01448                 //exit(0);
01449   }
01450 }*/
01451 
01452 
01453   //int start_point = random() & cp->bank_mask; /* randomized arbitration */
01454   int start_point = cp->start_point; /* round-robin arbitration */
01455   cp->start_point = modinc(cp->start_point,cp->banks);
01456 
01457   /* process write-backs */
01458   if(cp->check_for_WBB_work)
01459     for(b=0;b<cp->MSHR_banks;b++)
01460     {
01461       int bank = (start_point+b) & cp->MSHR_mask;
01462       if(cp->WBB_num[bank]) /* there are cast-outs pending to be written back */
01463       {
01464         struct cache_line_t * WBB = &cp->WBB[bank][cp->WBB_head[bank]];
01465 
01466         work_found = true;
01467         WBB_work_found = true;
01468         
01469         /* write back to main memory */
01470         if(cp->uncore->enqueuable(WBB->tag << cp->addr_shift,CACHE_WRITEBACK,sim_cycle))
01471         {
01473           //fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld][UnCore%d]Uncore Enqueue 0x%llx",sim_cycle,cp->uncore->node_ip,WBB->tag);
01474           cp->uncore->enqueue(NULL,CACHE_WRITEBACK,WBB->tag << cp->addr_shift,cp->linesize,(md_paddr_t)-1,0,NO_MSHR,NULL,NULL,NULL);
01475 
01476           WBB->dirty = false;
01477           WBB->dirty = false;
01478           cp->WBB_num[bank] --;
01479           cache_assert(cp->WBB_num[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01480           cp->WBB_head[bank] = modinc(cp->WBB_head[bank],cp->WBB_size); //(cp->WBB_head[bank] + 1) % cp->WBB_size;
01481         }
01482         
01483       }
01484     }
01485   cp->check_for_WBB_work = WBB_work_found;
01486 
01487 
01488 
01489   /*Check if any spills have arrived from memory*/
01490   if(cp->check_for_MSHR_fill_work)
01491     for(int b=0;b<cp->MSHR_banks;b++)
01492     {
01493       int bank = (start_point + b) & cp->MSHR_mask;
01494       if(cp->MSHR_fill_num[bank])
01495       {
01496         work_found = true;
01497         MSHR_fill_work_found = true;
01498         tick_t oldest = TICK_T_MAX;
01499         int old_index = -1;
01500 
01501         /* find oldest returned request to process */
01502         for(int i=0;i<cp->MSHR_size;i++)
01503         {
01504           struct cache_action_t * MSHR = &cp->MSHR[bank][i];
01505           if(MSHR->cb && (MSHR->when_returned <= sim_cycle) &&
01506                   cache_fillable_llc(cp,MSHR->paddr))
01507           {
01508             if(MSHR->when_enqueued < oldest)
01509             {
01510               oldest = MSHR->when_enqueued;
01511               old_index = i;
01512             }
01513           }
01514         }
01515 
01516         if(old_index < 0)
01517           continue;
01518 
01519         /* process returned MSHR requests that now need to fill the cache */
01520         struct cache_action_t * MSHR = &cp->MSHR[bank][old_index];
01521         bool bus_available = !MSHR->prev_cp || bus_free(MSHR->prev_cp->next_bus);
01522 
01523         if(MSHR->cb && (MSHR->when_returned <= sim_cycle) && bus_available)
01524         {
01525           if(!MSHR->MSHR_linked)
01526           {
01527             int insert = true;
01528             if(cp->PF_filter && (MSHR->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH))
01529               insert = prefetch_filter_lookup(cp->PF_filter,(MSHR->paddr>>cp->addr_shift));
01530 
01531             /* if using prefetch buffer, insert there instead */
01532             if((MSHR->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH) && (cp->PF_buffer) && insert)
01533             {
01534               struct prefetch_buffer_t *p, *evictee = NULL, *prev = NULL;
01535               p = cp->PF_buffer;
01536               while(p)
01537               {
01538                 if((MSHR->paddr>>cp->addr_shift) == (p->addr>>cp->addr_shift)) /* already been prefetched */
01539                   break;
01540                 if(!p->next || (p->addr == (md_paddr_t)-1))
01541                 {
01542                   evictee = p;
01543                   break;
01544                 }
01545                 prev = p;
01546                 p = p->next;
01547               }
01548 
01549               if(evictee) /* not found, overwrite entry */
01550                 p->addr = MSHR->paddr;
01551 
01552               /* else someone else already prefetched this addr */
01553               /* move to MRU position if not already there */
01554               if(prev)
01555               {
01556                 prev->next = p->next;
01557                 p->next = cp->PF_buffer;
01558                 cp->PF_buffer = p;
01559               }
01560             }
01561             else if(  (MSHR->cmd == CACHE_READ) || (MSHR->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH) ||
01562                      ((MSHR->cmd == CACHE_WRITE || MSHR->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK) && (cp->allocate_policy == WRITE_ALLOC)))
01563             {
01564               if(insert)
01565                 cache_fill_llc(cp,MSHR->cmd,MSHR->paddr,MSHR->core);
01566             }
01567           }
01568 
01569           if(MSHR->prev_cp)
01570           {
01571             /* everyone but the response from a writeback transfers a full cache line */
01572             bus_use(MSHR->prev_cp->next_bus,(MSHR->cmd==CACHE_WRITEBACK)?1:MSHR->prev_cp->linesize,MSHR->cmd==CACHE_PREFETCH);
01573             fill_arrived(MSHR->prev_cp,MSHR->MSHR_bank,MSHR->MSHR_index);
01574           }
01575 
01576           /* deallocate the MSHR */
01577           if(MSHR->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH)
01578           {
01579             cp->MSHR_num_pf[bank]--;
01580             cache_assert(cp->MSHR_num_pf[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01581           }
01582           MSHR->cb = NULL;
01583           cp->MSHR_num[bank]--;
01584           cp->MSHR_fill_num[bank]--;
01585           cache_assert(cp->MSHR_num[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01586           cache_assert(cp->MSHR_fill_num[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01587         }
01588       }
01589     }
01590   cp->check_for_MSHR_fill_work = MSHR_fill_work_found;
01591 
01592 
01593   /* process cache fills: */
01594   if(cp->check_for_fill_work)
01595     for(b=0;b<cp->banks;b++)
01596     {
01597       int bank = (start_point + b) & cp->bank_mask;
01598 
01599       struct cache_fill_t * cf = &cp->fill_pipe[bank][1];
01600       if(cp->fill_num[bank])
01601       {
01602         work_found = true;
01603         fill_work_found = true;
01604         if(cf->valid && cf->pipe_exit_time <= sim_cycle)
01605         {
01606           if(!cache_peek_llc(cp,cf->paddr)) /* make sure hasn't been filled in the meantime */
01607           {
01608             struct cache_line_t * p = cache_get_evictee_llc(cp,cf->paddr,cf->core);
01609             if(p->valid)
01610             {
01611               if(p->dirty)
01612               {
01613                 if(cp->write_policy == WRITE_BACK)
01614                 {
01615                   if(!WBB_available(cp,cf->paddr))
01616                     goto no_WBB_available; /* can't go until WBB is available */
01617                   WBB_insert(cp,p);
01618                 }
01619               }//TODO: invalidate the higher level of caches
01620               cache_invalidate(cp->prev_level,p->tag << cp->addr_shift ,NULL);
01621               if(cache_peek_llc(cp->prev_level,p->tag << cp->addr_shift))
01622                 fatal("line still present in upper level");
01623             }
01624 
01625             if(p->prefetched && cp->PF_filter)
01626             {
01627               prefetch_filter_update(cp->PF_filter,p->tag,p->prefetch_used);
01628             }
01629             p->valid = p->dirty = false; /* this removes the copy in the cache since the WBB has it now */
01630 
01631             cache_insert_block_llc(cp,cf->cmd,cf->paddr,cf->core);
01632           }
01633           fill_heap_remove(cp->fill_pipe[bank],cp->fill_num[bank]);
01634           cp->fill_num[bank]--;
01635           cache_assert(cp->fill_num[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01636         }
01637       }
01638     no_WBB_available:
01639       ;
01640     }
01641   cp->check_for_fill_work = fill_work_found;
01642 
01643 
01644 
01645   /* check last stage of cache pipes, process accesses */
01646   if(cp->check_for_pipe_work)
01647     for(b=0;b<cp->banks;b++)
01648     {
01649       int bank = (start_point + b) & cp->bank_mask;
01650 
01651       struct cache_action_t * ca = &cp->pipe[bank][1]; // heap root
01652       if(cp->pipe_num[bank])
01653       {
01654         /* These two determine whether to check the prefetcher(s) for
01655            new address(es) to prefetch.  We only do so when the request
01656            leaves the cache-lookup pipeline (request dequeued) to prevent
01657            double-prefetching */
01658         bool do_prefetch = !cp->prefetch_on_miss;
01659         bool request_dequeued = false;
01660 
01661         work_found = true;
01662         pipe_work_found = true;
01663         if(ca->cb)
01664         {
01665           if(ca->pipe_exit_time <= sim_cycle)
01666           {
01667             struct cache_line_t * line = cache_is_hit_llc(cp,ca->cmd,ca->paddr,ca->core);
01668             if(line != NULL) /* if cache hit */
01669             {
01670               if((ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITE || ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK) && (cp->write_policy == WRITE_THROUGH))
01671               {
01672                 if(!WBB_available(cp,ca->paddr))
01673                   continue; /* can't go until WBB is available */
01674 
01675                 struct cache_line_t tmp_line;
01676                 tmp_line.core = ca->core;
01677                 tmp_line.tag = ca->paddr >> cp->addr_shift;
01678                 tmp_line.valid = true;
01679                 tmp_line.dirty = false;
01680 
01681                 /* on a write-through cache, use a WBB entry to send write to the next level */
01682                 WBB_insert(cp,&tmp_line);
01683               }
01684 
01685               /* For L1 caches only: (L2/LLC handled by MSHR processing later)
01686                  invoke the call-back function; the action-id check makes sure the request is
01687                  still valid (e.g., a request is invalid if the original uop that initiated
01688                  the request had been flushed due to a branch misprediction). */
01689               if(!ca->prev_cp && ca->op && (ca->action_id == ca->get_action_id(ca->op)))
01690               {
01691                 ca->cb(ca->op);
01692               }
01693 
01694               if((cp == cp->uncore->LLC) && (ca->core))
01695                 CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.core_lookups[ca->core->current_thread->id]++;)
01696 
01697               if(ca->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH)
01698                 CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.prefetch_lookups++;)
01699               else
01700               {
01701                 if(ca->cmd == CACHE_READ)
01702                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.load_lookups++;)
01703                 else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITE)
01704                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.store_lookups++;)
01705                 else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK)
01706                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.writeback_lookups++;)
01707                 if(line->prefetched && !line->prefetch_used)
01708                 {
01709                   line->prefetch_used = true;
01710                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.prefetch_useful_insertions++;)
01711                 }
01712               }
01713 
01714               /* fill previous level as appropriate */
01715               if(ca->prev_cp)
01716                 fill_arrived(ca->prev_cp,ca->MSHR_bank,ca->MSHR_index);
01717             }
01718             else /* miss in main data array */
01719             {
01720               int last_chance_hit = false;
01721 
01722               if((ca->cmd == CACHE_READ) ||
01723                  (ca->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH) ||
01724                  ((ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITE || ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK) && cp->write_combining))
01725               {
01726                 /* last chance: check in WBBs - this implements something like a victim cache */
01727                 int j;
01728 
01729                 int this_bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(ca->paddr);
01730                 int index = cp->WBB_head[this_bank];
01731                 for(j=0;j<cp->WBB_size;j++)
01732                 {
01733                   if(cp->WBB[this_bank][index].tag == (ca->paddr >> cp->addr_shift))
01734                   {
01735                     /* we're only write-combining with other existing writes;
01736                        i.e., no combining with non-dirty victim entries.
01737                        TODO: fix this by changing the WBB processing loop to
01738                        not assume a circular queue organization but to just
01739                        manually rescan the queue each time.
01740                      */
01741                     if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITE || ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK)
01742                     {
01743                       if(cp->WBB[this_bank][index].dirty)
01744                       {
01745                         CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.WBB_combines++;)
01746                         last_chance_hit = true;
01747                         break;
01748                       }
01749                     }
01750                     else
01751                     {
01752                       CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.WBB_hits++;)
01753                       CACHE_STAT(if(!cp->WBB[this_bank][index].victim) cp->stat.WBB_victim_hits++;)
01754                       last_chance_hit = true;
01755                       break;
01756                     }
01757                   }
01758                   index = modinc(index,cp->WBB_size);
01759                 }
01760 
01761                 if(cp->PF_buffer && !last_chance_hit)
01762                 {
01763                   struct prefetch_buffer_t * p = cp->PF_buffer, * prev = NULL;
01764                   while(p)
01765                   {
01766                     if((p->addr>>cp->addr_shift) == (ca->paddr>>cp->addr_shift))
01767                     {
01768                       last_chance_hit = true;
01769                       break;
01770                     }
01771                     prev = p;
01772                     p = p->next;
01773                   }
01774 
01775                   if(p) /* hit in prefetch buffer */
01776                   {
01777                     last_chance_hit = true;
01778 
01779                     /* insert block into cache */
01780                     struct cache_line_t * evictee = cache_get_evictee_llc(cp,ca->paddr,ca->core);
01781                     int ok_to_insert = true;
01782                     if((cp->write_policy == WRITE_BACK) && evictee->valid && evictee->dirty)
01783                     {
01784                       if(WBB_available(cp,ca->paddr))
01785                       {
01786                         WBB_insert(cp,evictee);
01787                       }
01788                       else /* we'd like to insert the prefetched line into the cache, but
01789                               in order to do so, we need to writeback the evictee but
01790                               we can't get a WBB.  */
01791                       {
01792                         ok_to_insert = false;
01793                       }
01794                     }
01795 
01796                     if(ok_to_insert && cache_fillable_llc(cp,ca->paddr))
01797                     {
01798                       cache_invalidate(cp->prev_level,evictee->tag << cp->addr_shift,NULL);
01799                       if(cache_peek_llc(cp->prev_level,evictee->tag << cp->addr_shift))
01800                         fatal("line still present in upper level");
01801                       evictee->valid = evictee->dirty = false;
01802                       cache_fill_llc(cp,CACHE_PREFETCH,p->addr,ca->core);
01803                     }
01804                     else /* if we couldn't do the insertion for some reason (e.g., no WBB
01805                             entry for dirty evictee or now fill bandwidth, move the
01806                             block back to the MRU position in the PF-buffer and hope
01807                             for better luck next time. */
01808                     {
01809                       if(prev)
01810                       {
01811                         prev->next = p->next;
01812                         p->next = cp->PF_buffer;
01813                         cp->PF_buffer = p;
01814                       }
01815                     }
01816                   }
01817                 }
01818               }
01819 
01820               if(last_chance_hit)
01821               {
01822                 /* only invoke callback if this is an L1 cache (see earlier comment
01823                    for a regular cache hit. */
01824                 if(!ca->prev_cp && ca->op && (ca->action_id == ca->get_action_id(ca->op)))
01825                   ca->cb(ca->op);
01826 
01827                 if((cp == cp->uncore->LLC) && (ca->core))
01828                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.core_lookups[ca->core->current_thread->id]++;)
01829 
01830                 if(ca->cmd == CACHE_READ)
01831                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.load_lookups++;)
01832                 else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH)
01833                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.prefetch_lookups++;)
01834                 else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITE)
01835                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.store_lookups++;)
01836                 else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK)
01837                   CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.writeback_lookups++;)
01838 
01839                 /* fill previous level as appropriate */
01840                 if(ca->prev_cp)
01841                   fill_arrived(ca->prev_cp,ca->MSHR_bank,ca->MSHR_index);
01842               }
01843               else /* ok, we really missed */
01844               {
01845                 /* place in MSHR */
01846                 do_prefetch = true;
01848 
01849                 if(MSHR_available(cp,ca->paddr))
01850                 {
01851                   if(ca->cmd!=CACHE_WRITEBACK)
01852                   {
01854                         struct cache_action_t * MSHR = MSHR_allocate(cp,ca->paddr,ca->cmd);
01855                         bool MSHR_linked = MSHR->MSHR_linked;
01856                         *MSHR = *ca;
01857                         MSHR->when_enqueued = sim_cycle;
01858                         MSHR->when_started = TICK_T_MAX;
01859                         MSHR->when_returned = TICK_T_MAX;
01860                         MSHR->core = ca->core;
01861                         MSHR->MSHR_linked = MSHR_linked;
01862                         int this_bank = GET_MSHR_BANK(ca->paddr);
01863                         if(MSHR_linked)
01864                           MSHR->when_started = sim_cycle;
01865                         else
01866                         {
01867                           cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num[this_bank]++;
01868                           cache_assert(cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num[this_bank] <= cp->MSHR_size,(void)0);
01869                         }
01870                         cp->MSHR_fill_num[this_bank]++;
01871                         cache_assert(cp->MSHR_fill_num[this_bank] <= cp->MSHR_size,(void)0);
01872         
01873                         /* update miss stats when requests *leaves* the cache pipeline to avoid double-counting */
01874                         if(ca->core)
01875                         {
01876                           CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.core_lookups[ca->core->current_thread->id]++;)
01877                           CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.core_misses[ca->core->current_thread->id]++;)
01878                         }
01879         
01880                         if(ca->cmd == CACHE_READ)
01881                         {
01882                           CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.load_lookups++;)
01883                           CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.load_misses++;)
01884                         }
01885                         else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_PREFETCH)
01886                         {
01887                           CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.prefetch_lookups++;)
01888                           CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.prefetch_misses++;)
01889                           cp->MSHR_num_pf[MSHR->MSHR_bank]++;
01890                           cache_assert(cp->MSHR_num_pf[MSHR->MSHR_bank] <= cp->MSHR_size,(void)0);
01891                         }
01892                         else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITE)
01893                         {
01894                           CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.store_lookups++;)
01895                           CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.store_misses++;)
01896                         }
01897                         else if(ca->cmd == CACHE_WRITEBACK)
01898                         {
01899                           CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.writeback_lookups++;)
01900                           CACHE_STAT(cp->stat.writeback_misses++;)
01901                         }
01902                   }
01903                 }
01904                 else
01905                   continue; /* this circumvents the "ca->cb = NULL" at the end of the loop, thereby leaving the ca in the pipe */
01906               }
01907             }
01908 
01909             cache_heap_remove(cp->pipe[bank],cp->pipe_num[bank]);
01910             cp->pipe_num[bank]--;
01911             cache_assert(cp->pipe_num[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01912             request_dequeued = true;
01913 
01914             if(do_prefetch && request_dequeued)
01915               if(ca->PC && (ca->cmd == CACHE_READ))
01916               {
01917                 int ii;
01918                 for(ii=0;ii<cp->num_prefetchers;ii++)
01919                 {
01920                   md_paddr_t pf_addr = cp->prefetcher[ii]->lookup(ca->PC,ca->paddr);
01921 
01922                   if(pf_addr & ~(PAGE_SIZE-1)) /* don't prefetch from zeroth page */
01923                   {
01924                     int j;
01925 
01926                     /* search PFF to see if pf_addr already requested */
01927                     int already_requested = false;
01928                     int index = cp->PFF_head;;
01929                     for(j=0;j<cp->PFF_num;j++)
01930                     {
01931                       if(cp->PFF[index].addr == pf_addr)
01932                       {
01933                         already_requested = true;
01934                         break;
01935                       }
01936                       index = modinc(index,cp->PFF_size);
01937                     }
01938                     if(already_requested)
01939                       continue; /* for(i=0;...) */
01940 
01941                     /* if FIFO full, overwrite oldest */
01942                     if(cp->PFF_num == cp->PFF_size)
01943                     {
01944                       cp->PFF_head = modinc(cp->PFF_head,cp->PFF_size); //(cp->PFF_head + 1) % cp->PFF_size;
01945                       cp->PFF_num--;
01946                       cache_assert(cp->PFF_num >= 0,(void)0);
01947 
01948                     }
01949 
01950                     cp->PFF[cp->PFF_tail].PC = ca->PC;
01951                     cp->PFF[cp->PFF_tail].core = ca->core;
01952                     cp->PFF[cp->PFF_tail].addr = pf_addr;
01953                     cp->PFF_tail = modinc(cp->PFF_tail,cp->PFF_size); //(cp->PFF_tail + 1) % cp->PFF_size;
01954                     cp->PFF_num++;
01955                     cache_assert(cp->PFF_num <= cp->PFF_size,(void)0);
01956                   }
01957                 }
01958               }
01959           }
01960         }
01961         else /* !ca->cb */
01962         {
01963           cache_heap_remove(cp->pipe[bank],cp->pipe_num[bank]);
01964           cp->pipe_num[bank]--;
01965           cache_assert(cp->pipe_num[bank] >= 0,(void)0);
01966         }
01967       }
01968     }
01969   cp->check_for_pipe_work = pipe_work_found;
01970 
01971 
01972 /*Check MSHR for requests waiting to be sent to lower levels of memory*/
01973   if(cp->check_for_MSHR_work)
01974   {
01975         //if(strcmp(cp->name,"LLC")==0)
01976           //    fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld]%s Bus to Next level available", sim_cycle, cp->name);
01977         /* Prioritized handling of MSHR requests by type (read, write, prefetch, writeback) */
01978         int sent_something = false;
01979         int c;
01980 
01981         for(c=0;c<4 && !sent_something;c++)
01982         {
01983           enum cache_command cmd = cp->MSHR_cmd_order[c];
01984 
01985           for(b=0;b<cp->MSHR_banks;b++)
01986           {
01987             int bank = (start_point+b) & cp->MSHR_mask;
01988             if(cp->MSHR_num[bank])
01989             {
01990               work_found = true;
01991               MSHR_work_found = true;
01992               /* find oldest not-processed entry */
01993               if((!cp->next_bus || bus_free(cp->next_bus)) && (cp->MSHR_unprocessed_num[bank] > 0))
01994               {
01995                 tick_t oldest_age = TICK_T_MAX;
01996                 int index = -1;
01997 
01998                 for(int i=0;i<cp->MSHR_size;i++)
01999                 {
02000                   struct cache_action_t * MSHR = &cp->MSHR[bank][i];
02001                   if((MSHR->cmd == cmd) && MSHR->cb && (MSHR->when_started == TICK_T_MAX)) 
02002                   {
